data.title: Student Success Advisors & Staff
data.text:
Dr. Cassandra Green - Assistant Vice President

Dr. Cassandra C. Green (Cassie) is the Assistant Vice-President of the Office of Student Success at Delaware State University (DSU). She earned a BA in psychology, and an MA in counselor education from Indiana University of PA (IUP), in 1984 and 1985 respectively; and an EdD in Educational Leadership from Wilmington University in 2010. She has r 38 years in higher education, providing service in a variety of higher education institutions (community college, 4-year private and public institutions), in a variety of appointed positions (faculty-advisor to special talent athletes, assistant professor, adjunct faculty, educational counselor, assistant director, director, faculty field advisor for doctoral program, Title III activity director, |and assistant vice-president), in a variety of practices and models in Higher Education administration in Student Affairs (learning center |Act 101, developmental studies, academic advising for student athletes, pre-fall and summer bridge programs, and minority honors program) and Academic Affairs (academic enrichment, university college, academic support services, office of student success, summer bridge programs, paraprofessional peer educator training and supervision, first-year experience courses and students-in-transition services, assessment of student learning outcomes, development courses |programs, and disability support). She is a published author, with an extensive list of presentations in assessment and developing student learning outcomes for paraprofessional peer educator training programs.

Her passion lies in teaching how to trigger innate meta-cognitive abilities and memory processes using the mind-mapping study technique to engage students in active learning. If you visit Dr. Green’s office, you will find several of her favorite study mind maps created by the students she taught during the first 20 years of her teaching and advising career.

Hometown: Philadelphia, PA, USA

Fun Fact: At the time of accepting the position as Director of Academic Support Services at DSU years ago, I was being considered for hire at Cheyney University, where I interviewed with the Associate VP of University College, Dr. Robin Williams, (the wife of DSU’s 10th President, Dr. Harry Williams)!

Educational background:

Ed.D. 2010 - Educational Leadership (Wilmington University, Dover, DE)

M.A. 1985 - Counselor Education (Indiana University of PA, Indiana, PA).

B.A. - Psychology (Indiana University of PA, Indiana, PA)

Why did you decide to work here at Delaware State? I was hired as the Director of Academic Support Programs, working in the Division of Academic Enrichment. I brought extensive knowledge and experience in higher education, tweaking and developing student success program models that yield a significant impact on student retention, persistence, and graduation rates. And I finally got a position at DSU - my first and only HBCU ever!

Contact Info:

Email: CGreen [at] desu.edu

Phone: 302.857.6388

Location: William C. Jason Library - Room 223B

Why did you decide to work here at Delaware State? For most of my adult life, I have worked with youth and young adults. Also, I have a passion for young adults and care very much about the path they take and what they are able to contribute to society, once they graduate from DSU. I love it at DSU! This is the place God has placed me to use my gifts and talents for His students!

Why did you decide to work here at Delaware State? As a doctoral student, I worked as an undergraduate students’ Academic Advisor. I enjoyed assisting students transition from high school to college, then guiding them through their course requirements and educational goals. It was rewarding to see students perform well in their coursework and qualify to join the academic major of their choice. After witnessing some of the challenges underrepresented students face on campus, I wanted to work at an HBCU to help students overcome these challenges. I decided to work as an academic advisor here at Delaware State University because I want to use my experience and skills to contribute towards our students’ academic success.

Why did you decide to work here at Delaware State? Delaware State has always been home to me and coming back to lead the Sophomore Year Experience Program has been a dream come true. I genuinely believe that positively impacting one person causes a butterfly effect that will eventually change the world, making it a better place for all. With that being my mission, there’s nowhere better to impact young lives than The Illustrious Delaware State University positively.
